website_summaries.verdict: The Roomba 880 is the most well-rounded, capable bot we've encountered so far, but the $449 Neato Robotics XV Signature Pro still wins the pet hair performance test on all flooring surfaces.
pros: The iRobot Roomba 880 replaces its predecessor's bristly brushes with rubbery "extractors" as part of the new AeroForce cleaning system
This brushless technology removes debris better than previous iterations and keeps maintenance to a minimum
cons: The bin is supposedly larger than in previous Roomba models, but it still fills up too quickly when you're dealing with dust and shedding pets

customer_reviews.title: Save your Money Buy an Upright
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Irobot the 880,is no better than the 780,damaged my furniture,there is no rubber padding on the rear of the machine rams your funiture,Spins and scratches,table legs,Ruined a filing cabnet ramming into it.Golf ball size vacuum motor,find it stuck under,and against furniture and corners.No algorism for a pattern of cleaning.Can't find the way back to the charging dock.My last robot vacuum!
customer_reviews.author: Roger M Glass

customer_reviews.title: I'm suntanning and writing a review while my house is being vacuumed!
customer_reviews.text: I really wish I would have jumped on the Roomba wagon much earlier. My 880 has seriously changed my cleaning routine. With two dogs and tile/wood combo flooring, I'm constantly sweeping and vacuuming in an effort to keep up with the pet hair alone. Those days are over! I've had my Roomba for two weeks now (I'll be sure to update if there are any issues!) and it's amazing. It picks up pet hair with a breeze and navigates my home effortlessly. I highly recommend this purchase. The time I've been able to spend elsewhere because I'm no longer doing the vacuuming is worth every penny I've spent on this!
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. V

customer_reviews.title: Great floor cleaner...clean often if you have pets
customer_reviews.text: Roomba does a very good job cleaning. If you have pets it’ll require frequent cleaning. We use ours in the living room where the dogs aren’t allowed, but the drifting hair alone requires cleaning of the rollers, otherwise, roomba starts leaving hair balls behind. It also has problems on 1 rug we have with geometric patterns. When it comes to a black circle its fall sensor thinks it is at the edge of the stairs and it stops and requires restarting, but that’s more amusing than annoying. Keep it clean and charged and it will work great cleaning your floors.
customer_reviews.author: Sttomper

customer_reviews.title: Works great and haven't had any issues
customer_reviews.text: With two long haired cats, we always have fur tumbleweeds somewhere on our floors. We purchased the roomba to help keep our floors clean during the week without us having to drag out the vacuum. I really wish we purchased this along time ago because it has been amazing! It cleans our wood floors, carpet, and rugs without any issues. Maintenance is easy as well; we just empty the bin when it says it's full and check the rollers to make sure nothing is clogged or tangled. Overall I highly recommend this roomba.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: It is so nice to just start it up and let it run ...
customer_reviews.text: Had to return the first one due to an electronic glitch and was just inside the 30 day return with Amazon. Got the replacement about 3-4 months ago and no problems. It is so nice to just start it up and let it run in the morning and evening to be able to keep up with a large house and 3 pets. Really has lightened our load keeping the pet fur under control.
customer_reviews.author: BSM

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: There is really nothing to like about this item. It seldom returns to the dock, it leaves a trail pet hair, the capacity of the tank is too small, the remote does not work most of the time, and at least once each gets stuck somewhere and had to be freed manually.
customer_reviews.author: Payton

customer_reviews.title: High hopes. Big disappointment.
customer_reviews.text: 880 was unable to pick up the dog hair from our area rugs. Worked with iRobot to resolve the situation, but the issue persisted after several different "fixes" - we actually had to start using our old vacuum to pick up the hair. After further research, other owners have reported the same issue - the 880 supposedly struggles to differentiate when going from hardwood to area rugs and the mechanism doesn't do its job properly. Hoped this machine was going to live up to its potential, but due to its inability to clean our apartment and the expensive price tag, it was a no brainer to return the unit. Love iRobot as a company, but truly disappointed in this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Does a decent job unattended
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly quiet for a vacuuming device. With severalplaced strategically around the house, it covers 2 "zones" (first the Kitchen + Family Room + Office, then the Living Room + Dining Room) without me having to keep an eye on it. Takes something like 1.5 hours or so. Disadvantage: it misses some spots due to the "random" patterns, and the fact that it decides an area is complete just a little too early. iRobot's documentation gives little insight into how it "decides" when a room (area) is "done", and it's a little too aggressive for my taste. It needs about another 50% of the time it chooses, in order to get things "clean enough", the majority of the time.
customer_reviews.author: tgi

customer_reviews.title: 1 year honeymoon.
customer_reviews.text: I loved my Roomba but it is getting a 1 star for the customer service today. The gentleman was nice enough but guess what.... when this gem goes out of warranty and we are talking just out of warranty, if it isn't easily fixable they don't take it back and refurbished it or repair it they tell you to buy a service one. Guess how much? $440. Yep that's right. Like you didn't already pay a nice tidy sum now after a touch over a year you're screwed for $440 more dollars. If you purchase this just beware, the honeymoon only last a year.
customer_reviews.author: romel1088

customer_reviews.title: A+++
customer_reviews.text: Amazing, I can't believe I didn't do this sooner. We have a golden retriever and a lab and they were covering my house in hair.I work full time, go to school full time, have two little boys and a baby on the way. I named her "Hilga" the cleaning lady and she gives me so much time back. Worth every penny, and was at my door in two days. Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Roomba 880 needs fine tuning
customer_reviews.text: I so, so wanted to love my Roomba 880. It does a decent job vacuuming but what we didn't like was that it scrapes against the baseboards, keeps trying to climb the low hearth, which is painted, gets lost under furniture and stuck in corners. If they could remedy these complaints I'd buy one again. Sadly, mine is on its way back to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Sheryl from California

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: Love this labor saving device. Cut it on and leave your home. It will do the work. The cleaning reservoir compartment is not huge, but acceptable. It will park itself when the compartment is full. With two Shelties, the compartment for holding the hair,etc. can fill up relatively fast...but that's because its doing its job. Just pull out the reservoir, dump into the trash, reinsert and put it back to work. Its very easy to do and takes only a minute. The more you run it, the longer it takes for the reservoir to fill too quickly.
customer_reviews.author: GLL

customer_reviews.title: Not good with pets!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this with the expectations it was good for pet hair, wrong! I vacuum daily and started having this come on at 6:00 am every morning. It can't even do 2 rooms without plugging up. I have 2 labs but they are brushed daily and besides trying to use the iRobot and once a day vacuuming I was very sorry I purchased for this amount of money! If you have pets I would not recommend. If you do not have pets then it would probably work for you.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie Fez

customer_reviews.title: Works well on on all surfaces, still going after two years
customer_reviews.text: Have had it for over two years now and use it quite often as we have a big house, mainly hardwood floors, few area rugs, three bedrooms with carpet and til as well as linoleum. It works well on most areas. Sometimes gets stuck under certain furniture. The invisible wall pods don't always work so sometimes we use something to block the path. The battery just died after two years, we got a replacement on Amazon and it is like a whole new vacuum. It doesn't take place of normal vacuuming but really help things cleaner.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Great for cat hair! Our house has never been this clean!
customer_reviews.text: We love our new Roomba! I don't know that I would have spent our own money on this--since it is so expensive--but it was a gift and one of the BEST gifts we have ever received! We have 3 kids and 3 cats...the Roomba does a fantastic job picking up tons of cat hair, going around and under all the furniture, etc. Seriously...our house has never been this clean! Our daughter does have long hair and every once in a while, we need to pick up the Roomba and unwrap any long hairs that have gotten caught up in it. (This has never impacted performance or anything else.) LOVE LOVE LOVE the Roomba!!!
customer_reviews.author: SES

customer_reviews.title: IRobot Products are designed to fail shortly after WARRANTY EXPIRES
customer_reviews.text: I would give 0 stars if I could. NEVER BUY AN IRobot Product EVER. ROOMBAS ARE DESIGNED TO FAIL SHORTLY AFTER THE WARRANTY EXPIRES SO THAT YOU ARE FORCED TO BUY A NEW ONE. MY FIRST 880 HAD TO BE REPLACED ONLY HALF A YEAR AFTER PURCHASE AND GUESS WHAT? THEY DON'T EXTEND THE 1 YEAR WARRANTY OF THE NOT NEW REPLACEMENT UNIT! THATS RIGHT, YOU ARE SCREWED EITHER WAY. I'M NEVER BUYING A ROBOT CLEANER FROM THIS DISHONEST COMPANY EVER AGAIN.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: I'm definitely in the honeymoon phase
customer_reviews.text: I have had my new Roomba 880 friend for 1 week now and am head over heels in love. It does an amazing job on the cat hair and navigates from my hardwoods to area rugs with fringe to plush wall to wall carpet in different rooms with ease. I am also convinced it is sucking up way more dirt/hair than my upright vacuum ever did. Why did I wait so long to get one?! I am definitely beyond satisfied with the 880 after week 1 and hope it is built to last so that we can spend many happy clean and lazy years together.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I am really surprised about the amount of dust and hair this thing picks up. It's easy to dump out all the debris and pop back in. I have it set to go off everyday around 10:30am, when no one is home. It can be annoying when trying to watch tv or concentrate on anything really because it can be loud. Our home is about 1500sqFt and it goes and cleans everything without needing to recharge. Sometimes it has a really hard time docking even though the station is literally two feet away. Its kind of entertaining actually, but does get annoying. Overall I completely recommend. This little guy can really do its job.
customer_reviews.author: Angeline

customer_reviews.title: Great Vacuum, but a little forgetful at times.
customer_reviews.text: Our robot cleaner, named Marsha, was great at first, picking up pet hair and finding her way around the house. But she has been slacking off and I have had to reprogram her scheduling once or twice. Also, the rubber rollers that suck up the pet hair have split in half. I will ask for a warrenty claim and hopefully get another set. Otherwise she is great, we got an addition and she learned it really quickly. We have about 4 rooms she goes in.
customer_reviews.author: Annie Maher

customer_reviews.title: Not at all worth the price
customer_reviews.text: I have had a more expensive Roomba before and it was amazing, this product is terrible. It is not “smart” in the least. And after almost 6 months of use, in my tiny house, it still can’t find its way back to the dock, and gets stuck on literally everything. Do not, I repeat, do not, waste your money on this. Spend a little more and get the superior product. I am writing this after yet another Saturday afternoon following my iRobot around helping it clean.
customer_reviews.author: Brenna

customer_reviews.title: Fired the housekeeper after running this for a week
customer_reviews.text: Great on hard wood floors as well as carpet. Has no problem picking up dog hair...we were shocked at what it picked up compared to our regular vacuum. Easy to schedule and so nice to come home to a clean home after work.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My new best friend
customer_reviews.text: I named mine "Roger". Yes, he was expensive, but oh....SO worth it! Even my husband likes to vacuum now. We don't run it on an automatic schedule because with our pets we usually have to clean out the dust bin once or twice during a cycle. Also, I like to keep an eye on him just in case he runs into any little hangups anywhere. I've wanted one of these for years and finally just bit the bullet and ordered it. The house even smells better after Roger parks himself in his little recharger. I love how he can get under chairs and coffee tables. I am always amazed with how much stuff he picks up!
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia E. Ramming

customer_reviews.title: Not as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I would not buy this again. I have to babysit it too much, and it doesn't follow the sweeping pattern as advertised. It is always needing its wheels cleaned or spun to work again, then after several minutes I have to do it again. Very annoying, but I was past the time to be able to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff M

customer_reviews.title: a bit stupid, but does the job
customer_reviews.text: It gets stuck on half-inch thresholds between rooms. It can no longer find its base. It bumps into its lighthouses and dislocates them. "Turn in a random direction" is clearly a huge part of its programming, which appears stupid but is actually wise, since with purely deterministic programming, a programming error would result in certain areas of the floor consistently being passed over. With randomness, it cannot guarantee that it will cover the entire floor surface in one run, but it doesn't need to, since it can easily run daily and keep the floor clean through small consistent efforts. It does result in cleaner floors, but expect to have to rescue it frequently.
customer_reviews.author: Vladimir Kornea

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I had no idea how good this thing worked. It cleans the entire ground floor of our house relentlessly (kitchen, dining room, breakfast area, family room, office, bedroom, master bath with two closets, guest bath) , and collects under furniture where we had great difficulty reaching. I was a bit confused on how to use the two lighthouses but finally got them configured in the correct places. iRobot has a video on how to place them if you use them in that mode versus an "invisible wall." Here is the link:
customer_reviews.author: Russ

customer_reviews.title: Don't know how we survived without one
customer_reviews.text: I bought this unit as a replacement and it works just great. We have both a cat and a dog and both shed a lot of fur. But this unit picks it all up without any hassle at all. Yes, I would recommend it to a friend. However, keep in mind that the company that builds them will not fix one if it breaks unless it is still under a warranty. Once the warranty expires, you're on you own. Which is why I bought this one. My first one lasted 5 years then ran through a puddle of water. That killed it. But the warranty had expired so the company would not even talk about repairing it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael C Robertson

customer_reviews.title: Glad that I made this purchase. It works great.
customer_reviews.text: I was amazed at how well this cleaned. I vacuumed a room with our vacuum cleaner and then turned the Roomba loose in the same room. I couldn't believe how much more dust and cat hair that it picked up. I can set up the lighthouses and turn "Fred" loose. He will clean several rooms and then return to the dock. Very impressive. It does a great job picking up cat hair. It picked up enough cat hair that we could have made a new cat. I was concerned how well it would work on our oriental rugs that have fringe along the edge. "Fred" runs right over the fringe and never gets snagged.
customer_reviews.author: Ken220

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work as expected
customer_reviews.text: I am unsure how this product is this highly rated.Half the time the robot ignores the virtual walls and keeps moving beyond the point where I want it to go.Cleaning this is extremely painful.The bag full indicator glows in no time when I use it in my living area.Despite using it many times it doesn’t understand the pattern of cleaning and keeps doing random things.Overall not happy at all and feel stupid for having paid this high a price for a machine which didn’t meet my expectation.I read these reviews here and then purchased and by the time I wanted to return it I was past my return window so had no choice but to keep it.
customer_reviews.author: vasanth

customer_reviews.title: I love Alfred!
customer_reviews.text: We named our roomba Alfred and he is part of the family. Very happy with our purchase. With 2 dogs and Alfred does a great job helping to control the hair. He does need to be emptied a few times during a cleaning and needs replacement parts (brushes, rollers and filters) regularly to preform at his best. Considering buying Alfred a companion for the downstairs.
customer_reviews.author: Christin Mohr

customer_reviews.title: Great vacuum
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this Robot almost a year ago. Does a great job picking up everything. When you empty it, you'll see what was living in your carpet and it will make you gag. I have a 1200 square foot apartment which has about 1000 square foot carpeted. Has to be thoroughly cleaned quite frequently. Must clean the brushes off, clean all the hair out of spindles, the catch gets very filthy too. That's normal I guess. Comes with 2 filters which comes in handy. Overall a great vacuum, you will get your moneys worth. Now i just need a robot that picks up after 2 toddlers.
customer_reviews.author: will

customer_reviews.title: Could be "smarter" and drain less battery
customer_reviews.text: Initially, it started exploring apartment and it was quite fun to see the progress. As time went by, it still finds spots where to stuck, or make loops over and over again, bumping into the same furniture over and over again and does not look very "smart" at all. It does its job so far though. Lighthouse/virtual wall points drain battery like crazy. Buy a handful of Ds, you'll need to replace them regularly. They do not notify when a ​battery is dead however and you may not know that virtual wall is not working anymore until you find out that Roomba made a pure mess with cat's food and water.
customer_reviews.author: Eduard D

customer_reviews.title: Customer Service: Zero Stars
customer_reviews.text: Never, ever buy one of these if you have a dog. Ours will not pick up dog hair, that was bad enough, but then we had the misfortune to contact Customer Service. It is considerably easier to complete Tough Mudder, at freezing point, in your underwear, than to overcome the obstacles that irobot customer service will throw at you in droves. We bought this unit 6th June, 2017, and, here we are 6th January, 2018; with a non functioning unit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Beyond my Expectations
customer_reviews.text: I was very skeptical about a robot that could clean my condo. I bought it as a toy, but I praise it as a useful tool. I set it to clean my 1100 square foot apartment at 10am every day. When I come home it is nestled back in it's dock and it is filled with dust bunnies and dirt. After 10 days my allergies have subsided, and my apartment is much cleaner. I hate cleaning. This device is a godsend. It is not perfect. It occasionally gets stuck under my sofa. But, I would never ever clean under my sofa, so the 2 times a week it gets stuck is worth the aggravation. Great product. Well done!
customer_reviews.author: Todd A. Rosenthal

customer_reviews.title: happy cat owner
customer_reviews.text: Life changer! As a cat owner with tons of carpet in the house it works great. It is also very good picking up the trace of kitty litter left outside the box. It is easy to clean. It is a great satisfaction to get home to clean floors having no effort put in it. It does have some flaws like if there is a door open and it pushes it to clean under and at times it locks itself in the bathroom for example, but I will take that over doing it myself. PS Sadly my cat doesn't ride it :p
customer_reviews.author: M.C.

customer_reviews.title: 4 years and going strong!
customer_reviews.text: I have had my roomba 880 for 4 years, and my only real issue with it is that it is still going strong so I can't justify upgrading to one of the self-emptying models yet. We have a yellow lab and our daughter has long hair and it keeps up with everything.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING ROOMBA FOR PETS AND LONG HAIR
customer_reviews.text: I've been eyeing this roomba for a long time and I'm so glad it was on sale during the holiday sale. I have a big husky at home that sheds a lot & I really needed a good robotic vacuum to suck up all his fur. I've only had my roomba for less than a week and I'm already impressed by it. After much research into which vacuum cleaner is best for pet hair, I'm 100% convinced that this roomba is the best. I have a husky at home that sheds 24/7, but when I come home now my floors are so clean. The only negative comment I have about the roomba is it's a bit noisy.
customer_reviews.author: Eric W.

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed with the Roomba 880!
customer_reviews.text: We love our Roomba 880! We use it to clean a large area that includes our kitchen, dining room, living room, and another sitting room. It works great on our hardwood floors with area rugs. It picks up all the debris and dog hair. I have it running at 5am and it is incredibly quiet and doesn't wake us up in the morning. It's so nice to wake up to a clean floor. Overall, I think it does an incredible job. I'm amazed at how much it picks up even when I don't think our floors look that bad.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Vauuming happens that YOU DON'T HAVE TO DO!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this product.... the only people who would give this product a negative review are a) people who didn't read the instructions or b) people who don't vacuum.... It's like having a good-natured, happy, drunk, robot in your house... and are you ready for this... Vacuuming happens that YOU DON'T HAVE TO DO.... If she misses a spot, no problem, set her on it and hit the spot cleaning button and she gladly fixes it.... You will find yourself making all of your furniture Roomba safe for her to effortlessly slide under and you will tend to keep the clutter picked up... both bonuses! It's a fantastic product... if they made one to mow the lawn......
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: Bought this after reading Consumer Reports review.  Bottom line:  Consumer Reports review is accurate.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this after reading Consumer Reports review. IMHO, the Consumer Reports review isn't quite accurate. The unit does an okay job of picking up dirt and hitting most of the carpet. However, it leaves an unusual pattern in the carpet when travelling in certain directions. The best way I can describe it in type is ",.,.,.,.,.,.". In other words, the vast majority of the carpet is clean, but it has a less than professional appearance. It's a distant second to my regular vacuum, but it's great when I just want a robot to do the work.
customer_reviews.author: RockWall

customer_reviews.title: Our first Roomba and so far we couldn't be happier with it
customer_reviews.text: Our first Roomba and so far we couldn't be happier with it. Works great, picks up everything in its path, great with hair. Our only complaint is that it doesn't come with a small brush to clean the dirt bin when its done cleaning, for now were just using a cheap 1" painters brush - works good. Other than that were very happy with this model, since it can clean multiple rooms on a single charge and having the hepa filter is a plus.
customer_reviews.author: Sandro

customer_reviews.title: good but could use some simple improvements
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Cleans well Cleans completely Doesn't get jammed up Programming feature is nice Cons: Can get stuck - it constantly gets stuck in between legs of a stool. It uses the same pattern to try to get out which means it just hits the same spot on the stool legs until the battery runs out Needs to be reprogrammed constantly - if it gets stuck in the stool, it will twirl around until battery runs out. If battery runs out, it looses the time and the clock needs to be set again. This should have an extra backup battery used jut for the clock.
customer_reviews.author: Karl Kuzbiel

customer_reviews.title: So far, so GREAT!
customer_reviews.text: I am in love with this Roomba. I've used it for about three weeks now, and once it learns the layout of your space, it really does an amazing job of getting in and cleaning! I primarily got it because I was tired of having to sweep multiple times per day for my dog and cats. Now, I just set the timer to clean while I am at work, and I have dirt and hair-free floors when I get home. It's incredible when you open up the bin and see how much this little thing picks up! And I LOVE how it docks itself after every use. Spend the little bit extra and GET THIS ROOMBA!
customer_reviews.author: D. Scott

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Can't say enough about my new "Robby"! Got it for Christmas and so far it has done everything I expected it to. We have pets and I needed a quick cleanup in between once a week hard cleaning. I did have to empty it twice on the 2nd day so I will run it while I am at home. We have a retriever and she sheds like crazy but Robby got it and more up. I would recommend this for a home with or without pets. Got it on a great one day deal and saved $99.
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product!!!
customer_reviews.text: Works excellent and really get the job done! It has made household upkeep WAY EASIER! The only downside is that the Roomba will get "stuck" when it tries to go over darker carpet. The sensor should keep it from going on it in the first place, but it will just barely do so and then stop cleaning. Other than that, it collects SO much dirt and dust and the compartment if FULL on a DAILY basis! Very happy with my purchase!!
customer_reviews.author: Weaver

customer_reviews.title: Now I get to spend extra time with kids instead of a dirty floor driving my crazy
customer_reviews.text: I found myself vacuuming daily. Wood floors with 2 boys,2 cats, a dog and husband! Fairly open and big area, running Romba 2x a day. No hair and the floor is clean. It does have quirks, but everything in life does. Now I get to spend extra time with kids instead of a dirty floor driving my crazy. I feel I still need to take a regular vacuum to carpeted bedrooms. There is 2. I have yet to see it go into room#2. When it does go into room one, I can see it doesn't hot the entire area. I would say Best for the hardwoods though!
customer_reviews.author: kelly

customer_reviews.title: Relatively Painless Cleaning
customer_reviews.text: The Roomba 880 cleans better than I had imagined. It is easy to operate, and I've been running it several times a week to keep the dust down. The robot vac frees me to do other cleaning tasks. I have a hardwood floors with carpets in the living and dining areas and an open kitchen-dining room-living room floor plan that the Roomba has no trouble navigating. I have long runner carpets in walk-through spaces; these have fringe at each end, but the Roomba had no trouble with the fringe. I had been concerned that it would get caught up, but no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Eclipsegroupie

customer_reviews.title: Does not have a brush like the 770 which seems to pick up better(I tried ...
customer_reviews.text: Gets stuck often at the edge of my stairway. Does not have a brush like the 770 which seems to pick up better(I tried one of a friends) Battery drains fast. Does not cover the entire floor. I really wish I would have purchased the 770 instead of the 880.
customer_reviews.author: gman

customer_reviews.title: This little vacuum does a great job against these odds
customer_reviews.text: I have dogs and cats and live in a dusty old wooden house. This little vacuum does a great job against these odds. I set it up to clean one room a day, go to work and come home to a clean room and the Roomba docked and recharged. When I am home it can work off and on all day (needs time to recharge). I have been wanting one of these forever and I love it. Haven't taught the cat to ride on it yet.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Major problems with battery - won't vacuum more than 15-20 minutes.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this vacuum in May 2015 and it looks like it is on the verge of death almost 2 years later. There are problems with charging since it won't vacuum for more than 15-20 minutes. I tried cleaning the debris, making sure the connection was proper but to no avail. This vacuum has a terrible life span.
customer_reviews.author: Anjali S.

customer_reviews.title: Terrific house mate !
customer_reviews.text: I was going to pay for a maid to clean once every three weeks. The Roomba is amazing!!! I love it. My dog loves it!!. It already paid for itself by all the work it does at my and not someone else's convenience. My regular vacuum cleaner ate a chunk of my oriental rug. The Roomba is sooo gentle with my oriental carpets. There is always universal dust to get and Roomba does not run out of energy. I rotate my rooms every day and keep him clean. All I have to do is dust and occasional floor wash. He keeps my house going. Thank you Roomba !!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Much better than expected.
customer_reviews.text: Works much much better than I could have hoped for. Really thorough and navigates flawlessly. Feels like we have a hired hand in the house! Our grandkids get a big kick out of it. They follow it around and talk about it--never did that with a regular upright vacuum! Also our two dogs ignore it. They just stay out of the way. Can do several rooms on one charge. Only negative is the limited capacity for dirt. Must be cleaned after each use. No big deal.
customer_reviews.author: Ollie

customer_reviews.title: My 3rd Roomba
customer_reviews.text: I love my Roombas. I have two I use on a daily basis, we have two large labs so it's needed. My daughter asked if she could borrow one for her apt. She loved it so much I didn't have the heart to ask for it back so I just got a 3rd. I hate the virtual walls, they seldom work, even with new batteries but the cleaner itself is amazing! A daily 2 minute maintenance keeps them in tip top shape.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine B

customer_reviews.title: Happy pet owner! Time saver!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for about a year so far. It's scheduled to run everyday. Being a cat owner, I've noticed much less fur on the floors and the corners of the rooms. It definitely helps around the litter box as well, picking up the litter the cats track out of the box. This is great for automatically cleaning up after the cats and me! :) I love having the floors vacuumed everyday and I love having that time back if I had to do it.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: My new best friend!
customer_reviews.text: Does not disappoint! Great for keeping up with the cat hair on a regular basis. Doesn't eat any of my cables/cords. The 2 included lighthouses/walls work really well and help so much with keeping it where you want it and out of where you don't. I'm very glad I went with this model and not one of the older ones. The rollers on this model do a great job with picking up hair and everything else and are super easy to clean! So much better than brushes!!
customer_reviews.author: troy0891

customer_reviews.title: NOT a Smart Robot. It's just a remote controlled vacuum with a remote on your phone. NO INTEGRATIONS with SmartHome hubs.
customer_reviews.text: Not a smart robot. Yes you can issue commands with your phone, but that's just a remote control. It does NOT integrate with any SmartHome hubs (SmartThings, Wink, HomeKit...) so the device only talks to itself. If it integrated with any SmartHome hub, you could program it to start when you leave for work, or when the garage door closes in the morning and so on.
customer_reviews.author: unisyean

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE it! It is much more advanced in its ...
customer_reviews.text: Years ago my son and daughter-in-law gave me one of the first roombas for Christmas. It wore out several years ago and I sorely missed it. This year I ordered the Roomba 880 for myself. I LOVE it! It is much more advanced in its cleaning power. I didn't realize my floors could be so dirty and I don't even have pets! I do have grandchildren though and they can be messy. I did wait for the price to go down because I could not afford the full price. Great purchase and clean floors!
customer_reviews.author: grandmaoftwelve

customer_reviews.title: Expensive - But Really Happy with it!
customer_reviews.text: Bought much earlier version like 2005. Liked it alot, but required alot of maintenance - cleaned ok to good, not great. Lots of time cleaning it after it vac. Great idea - but this one: pricey, but so far, very pleased. Cleans hardwood, ceramic tile & area rugs very, very well. Adjusts to varied floor types in one area very well - missed nothing! Cleaning it was a breeze. Still need to try it on carpeted room - but very hopeful. This thing functions really well! WORTH IT!!!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: The little Robot that could...
customer_reviews.text: I own a Dyson vacuum. I pride myself on clean floors. The Roomba put me to shame. I couldn't fathom the amount of dirt and hair it pulled up. I'll update this with a picture. After 2 weeks the amount has went down. 4 stars because my original developed an annoying squeak from its left module wheel on the second day. iRobot swapped it out as a courtesy. Which was amazing. But now after a week the new one has started to do it as well.
customer_reviews.author: Montana

customer_reviews.title: Love my new helper!
customer_reviews.text: I had to Roomba proof the house. After a few rounds I figured out what not to do. In a room there is a lot of furniture (legs & chairs) I have to watch it, because it will get stuck bumping into furniture & not make it back to base. Overall I am pleased with it. I dump the dust bin every day & very amazed at what it picks up on a daily basis. I recommend this product to all my co workers!
customer_reviews.author: Terri

customer_reviews.title: The robots are here, and they want to vacuum your floors
customer_reviews.text: I have held off buying a Roomba for years based on reviews that suggested that iRobot was headed in the right direction, but hadn't quite gotten it right. Well now, having emptied dozens of Roomba dust bins crammed full of dust and dog hair, I'm hooked. This machine cleans far more deeply than you'd expect based on the tiny flying saucer profile. My main problem with the Roomba thus far is that it doesn't always recognize the "light houses" that are supposed to confine the unit to a specific area. But what I love is the ability to schedule multiple cleanings per week. Beats waiting two weeks for the maids to arrive.
customer_reviews.author: Paoli Bulldog

customer_reviews.title: Make life easier!
customer_reviews.text: In the beginning, I wasn't sure if I liked it. But after using it every morning for about 20 to 30 minutes, the floors are devoid of dog hair and dust! It is so easy and does such a great job, that I haven't used my big vac in a while. I just steam mop every week or 10 days. Initially, I had to empty the bin a lot during the cycle. Now, usually I just empty it, clean the sensor windows and the rollers AFTER it is through. Then it is ready for the next day. I have mostly tile floors and a few area rugs. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: luvs2shop

customer_reviews.title: So Good, I had a cheaper
customer_reviews.text: Sofar, So Good, I had a cheaper, off brand robotic vac that kind of worked when it wasnt stuck. This unit has not been stuck once in the same location as the old unit, and to my amazement, this unit is pulling up dirt I never knew was there, that even an upright vacuum has missed. Also, this unit has found its way back to the dock 98% of the time before the battery quit. Very satisfied
customer_reviews.author: Jerry C

customer_reviews.title: This thing is AMAZING! I have it set to vacuum my place ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing is AMAZING! I have it set to vacuum my place at noon during the work week when I am not home. It allows you to schedule which days of the week you want it to work. I have my home professionally cleaned once a month, and this is a perfect companion to a deep cleaning. I am overly impressed by it. So impressed that I purchased a second one for my office two weeks after buying the first one. I would rate this a 10 out of 10. I am amazed at how little dust there is in my place now after using this daily.
customer_reviews.author: Adam L. Way

customer_reviews.title: Not the smartest robot, but does a great job cleaning (based on its bin)
customer_reviews.text: It can't find its docking station even when I place it 1-5 feet away from it, straight out, facing the correct direction. Let alone after its done cleaning (it has no memory of where its been and where its docking station is.. it just hopes it can randomly find it again). But, it does a fantastic job picking up dust and short dog hair off of the hardwood, tile, AND carpet floors. There is a little sensor on top that prevents it (by 1/4 inch) from getting under several pieces of furniture. The total height off the ground, including sensor, is exactly 9 cm (or just over 3.54 inches).
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Quit Charging!
customer_reviews.text: It quit charging after 6 months - very expensive purchase to not work 6 months later! The customer service dept. won't respond to my emails either! Very frustrated!!
customer_reviews.author: LSolly

customer_reviews.title: It's like my third pet
customer_reviews.text: Wish I could give this 10 stars. Saved my life. It's like my third pet. I love it and care for it like a pet. And all it eats is dirt. <3. If you are wavering between cheaper versions don't hesitate anymore. This roomba is worth every penny. One thing- never know if those remote towers are working or not. But the roomba has a knack for remembering where the house really needs cleaning. Have plenty of c batteries in stock for the towers though.
customer_reviews.author: C. Fox

customer_reviews.title: night worker
customer_reviews.text: i`m in love with roomba.it has been a blessing.just plug it in program it to your liking and it does the rest. we have it programmed for nite work.it is quiet enough that when we wake the entire room is vacuumed this was a gift i got for my husband & i. worth the money we really like Roby.everybody should have one.
customer_reviews.author: whimzbob

customer_reviews.title: I am truly amazed at how well this vacuum works
customer_reviews.text: I am truly amazed at how well this vacuum works! And, I appreciate the Virtual Wall Lighthouse beacons which allow me to control the cleaning area. It occasionally will get stuck in a tight spot, especially if there is also a change in floor level (such as the edge of a rug), so I avoid letting it run while I am not available to keep an eye on it. It does sound an 'alarm' to alert the consumer of troubles and provides audible troubleshooting codes to help you identify the problem should one occur.
customer_reviews.author: Cahaba Girl

customer_reviews.title: bad fan
customer_reviews.text: fan located in bin self destructed. It provides the main suction. Noticed that air no longer came from back vent. Cleaned level is mediocre with just rollers. Had to buy a replacement bin from irobot. Only had it a year.
customer_reviews.author: Leland

customer_reviews.title: Good quality product!
customer_reviews.text: It really does pick up pet hair & dust very well. I would like to have more options to program & limit the size of the area to clean. With only 2 lighthouses it maneuvers into too many other areas in a hit & miss manner. Better to clean 1 room at a time more thoroughly. Also needs a feature to have it move back & forth from the walls rather than in a criss cross, helter skelter manner. Meanwhile, I am very happy with the Roomba's cleaning quality. I have breathing problems which make it difficult to do heavy cleaning so the Roomba keeps my asthma much calmer.
customer_reviews.author: MaryB

customer_reviews.title: Pays for itself in first year!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Roomba. I bought a model 6 years ago and have only replaced the battery. Extremely reliable and decided to buy the 880 for my downstairs. The new model (880) has stronger vacuum. How do I know, the following items have been emptied at the end of the day: 1 paperclip, 1 US quarter, 1 US dime, 1 screw, 1 paper US dollar, 1 one inch long 1/4 inch diameter steel pin, and enough hair to claim I own a cat. LOL, it pays for itself within the first year of ownership, just empty it before another family member gets to it...
customer_reviews.author: Steven Smith

customer_reviews.title: I like it better than Neato Robotics
customer_reviews.text: After having to return two Neato Botvac vacuums because they arrived damaged and wouldn't work, I finally gave iRobot a try. I am sure glad I did because this vacuum is of much higher quality (it feels that way to me). It cleaned my condo, which has laminate flooring, very well. This vacuum is relatively quiet yet it had no problem picking up cat food and cat litter. I just received this vacuum in the mail and I will update my review if anything changes, as far as durability is concerned.
customer_reviews.author: N. Bergman

customer_reviews.title: We have three dogs and we love it. We run it daily and our floors ...
customer_reviews.text: We've had our Roomba for two weeks now. We have three dogs and we love it. We run it daily and our floors are all nice and clean. It's amazing how much dust and hair it picks up every day! We don't have carpet, only wood floors and tile. As others have said you have to be careful or it will lock itself in the bathroom until it runs out of charge. So if you want it to clean the bathrooms make sure you use something to prop the doors open. I have a girl who cleans my house once a week and she says she feels like she got a raise. I highly recommend him!
customer_reviews.author: Chip Devries

customer_reviews.title: I'm happy!
customer_reviews.text: Once I realized I need to program this thing and let it run once a day, I was much happier with it's performance. I have, well my wife has two cats, and I have a dog. This does a good job of keeping pet fur off the floor. But, like I wrote before, program it to run everyday if you have pets, otherwise it won't keep up. Seems to charge well and is very easy to maintain. Wheels all have snap access to clear jams or wound hair. I'm happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Definitely recommend for "hard" floors.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to help control dog hair (2 Mastiffs) on hard surfaces. Extremely pleased with the results. Running on schedule 4 times per week has saved me an hour a week in cleaning hair off floors. Watch the height of your furniture as if the bumpers fit under, but the top does not it can (and does) get stuck. Has also gotten stuck on dark area rug. Overall would definitely buy again for hard floors. Was not impressed by its ability on our thick carpet areas, you will need to vacuum behind it as the power cannot duplicate a full size appliance. Am still considering buying a 2nd just for hardwood areas that I have to move this one to.
customer_reviews.author: Asmodeus

customer_reviews.title: I haven't vacuumed as much in my lifetime as my ...
customer_reviews.text: I haven't vacuumed as much in my lifetime as my Roomba has done for me in the past couple of weeks. Cat hair be gone! It does require a bit of fuss to keep the bin empty, filter clean, and sensors dusted, but those are minor necessities. The charging stand is a bit light for the Roomba to consistently dock itself as it keeps pushing it rather than loading onto it - but no problem with me putting it on the dock manually. I can not speak to the durability as this is a new purchase, but I hope the Roomba keeps rolling for a long time. Can vacuuming really be a pleasure?
customer_reviews.author: DJ Keniley

customer_reviews.title: Great product from iRobot
customer_reviews.text: Great product from iRobot. Ran into a few minor product quality issues such as the bin liner minor defect, and squeaking sound - but I have to say that the customer support is top notch - one of the best companies that I've dealt with in terms of customer service. They sent me some replacement parts as my Roomba is still under warranty, and all through the web site support ticket system, and I didn't even need to call them to sort it out! Well done iRobot customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Wick

customer_reviews.title: Best Roomba Yet!
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Robot Vacuum in the last decade, and it is the best yet with: - Battery life - Rollers - Suction - Dust production - Appearance Previously owned a 660 and a 770, and this is the best yet (without the Wi-Fi frills I won't use)
customer_reviews.author: D Hartwell

customer_reviews.title: This is the best thing invented
customer_reviews.text: YEASSSS!!! This is the best thing invented. I have yet to sweep my house since we bought this. We can walk around barefoot and not feel any soot or dirt. I have two dogs and this handles the hair like a champ, and my animals SHED. Do have to empty it everyday, b/c it fills up with hair and dirt. But honestly, worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Marlon

customer_reviews.title: We bought this robot to clean our 1300 sq ft ...
customer_reviews.text: We bought this robot to clean our 1300 sq ft 2br condo, some how it randomly picks 2 out of 3 rooms to clean every time. Not sure if it's because the battery cannot last for cleaning the entire area. Other than that it meets the expectation.
customer_reviews.author: babybear

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Performance
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding product. I've been following the development of the Roomba for several years and was concerned that you had to clean the brushes after just about every use if you had pets. This model seems to have solved that problem with the new brush system it has. I have two dogs and two cats and I would recommend the Roomba 880 to anyone with pets. The only thing you have to clean after every use is the bin that collects the dirt in the Roomba, which is a plus I would think.
customer_reviews.author: Bob B.

customer_reviews.title: What??? even better???
customer_reviews.text: Had 600 series for years. Brushes constantly needed to be laboriously cleaned to remove pet hair. Small waste bin and small filter. I could not fix problem with brushes. I have an expensive Turkish carpet, and always worried about brushes removing wool. The new model is worth the price. The first few times I needed to empty the waste bin. After that, very little maintenance. My floors look much cleaner. My carpet is so colorful, and looks new. Must I go on?? I am buying one for a friend's birthday.
customer_reviews.author: amazonian aficionado

customer_reviews.title: Not for all types of pet hair.
customer_reviews.text: Does not have bristle brushes which were needed to pick up long hair. I have 2 border collies and a boxer. It picked up the boxer's hair but not the border collie's hair. The Roomba 600 or 700 series picks up the border collie hair. The 880 picks up dust really well! Buy carefully if you have dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: totally worth it - wife loves it
customer_reviews.text: best gift i ever bought my wife. we have a golden retriever, cleans up great with all the hair. watch a few youtube videos on how to clean it, how to understand the error messages. WORTH EVERY PENNY.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Agrons

customer_reviews.title: I just wanted to try it to see how good it worked
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, I fully expected that I would be sending this back within a couple of weeks. I just wanted to try it to see how good it worked, not really believing it was as good as they advertise. I've wasted probably close to a thousand dollars on vacuum cleaners that ended up tearing up or hardly cleaned at all. This is EXACTLY as advertised! I was absolutely floored by how well this cleaned my carpet. I just wish I'd went with a Roomba a long time ago instead of wasting so much money on many vacuums that never worked. HIGHLY recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Jamie C. King

customer_reviews.title: Good Product, Price way too high though.
customer_reviews.text: It's not a replacement for a vacuum, but it does do a nice job of keeping things tidy. It works best on wood/tile floors, but doesn't pick up as well on carpet or rugs. It doesn't get into many troubled situations. If it gets in a tight spot, it usually is able to get out of it fairly easily, which makes it to where I don't have to spend much time keeping an eye on it. It wasn't difficult to put together or program at all. The only thing I'm not a fan of is the price. Like I said, it isn't a replacement for a vacuum, so I'd save your money and just get a nice vacuum.
customer_reviews.author: Laura P.

customer_reviews.title: For the time you don't have
customer_reviews.text: We all like to think we'll vacuum more frequently especially those of us with shedding dogs. I purchased this to replace my bristle one because I got tired of cleaning the dog hair out of the brushes!! Works perfectly and I no longer see dust bunnies or dog hair piles under my living room chairs. Easy to program. One thing to keep in mind is that you have to cleaning the collection tray frequently.
customer_reviews.author: ImLvNIt

customer_reviews.title: ... and a baby and both my wife and I hate vacuuming. This thing has been a lifesaver
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 cats and a baby and both my wife and I hate vacuuming. This thing has been a lifesaver. While it takes a long time to do a full apartment it picks up a ton, is easy to clean, and easy to setup and use. It also provides my cats and I a source of entertainment. I'm very happy with this purchase and would buy it again without hesitation.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best gift ever ESP for pet owners!!
customer_reviews.text: Best gift ever I love this!!!! Vacuums every day on a timer! Full of dirt dust and pet hair everyday! I never sweep. Rides easily over normal carpet and rugs. May get stuck in a closet if it shuts the door. Otherwise goes around everything! Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Niki

customer_reviews.title: I'm happy with the product but it does not work on ...
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to try irobot for a yr and finally I got this for Thanks giving. I'm happy with the product but it does not work on my area rug, which is a big disappointment. It works great on the hard wood floor and stops (literally) in the area rug. I thought this is supposed to work on carpets and rugs, Is the expectation wrong?
customer_reviews.author: Ashwa

customer_reviews.title: WOW  What a Great Inv
customer_reviews.text: This device is a godsend. It does work while you are away and does an amazing job. It cleans in between the regular house cleanings and keeps the floors looking like they have just been cleaned everyday. We run our M-F at 10am while everyone is away and it does its thing. When we return we empty the collection tray and it is ready to go the next day. It made a big difference in our household since we have a cat. Keeps him company too. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby

customer_reviews.title: Great product, works fine.  You can purchase the same model much cheaper at Bed Bath and Beyond through 5/17/16  Caveat emptor!
customer_reviews.text: Great product, works as advertised and is fun to use! Bought on Amazon as we felt the price was as competitive as anywhere and we paid 699.00 plus shipping for a total of $727.00 Shortly after the purchase, we saw the same model (880) on sale at Bed Bath and Beyond for 594.99, a much better deal. We could not find a better price previously so it pays to shop around. Only disappointed in the price we paid as we thought Amazon had the best deal, not so.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Its awesome so far
customer_reviews.text: Its awesome so far. It does ram furniture a little bit, and the robot won't always find its home with the lighthouses. Another negative is the dust bin gets dust in the surrounding area when you empty the bin, and even though it is very detailed it sometimes does miss a spot. However, the positive of not having to vacuum --other than pushing a button-- outweighs the negatives buy a handful including the steep price tag. Make sure to read the manual. I found the part about charging the roomba all the way a little late.
customer_reviews.author: nichole

customer_reviews.title: Roomba 880
customer_reviews.text: Cute to watch it roll around, does reasonable job on light dirt. But, difficult to clean out 'bin' when its full of dust/dirt. Does not respond well to remote control to dock sometimes does, sometimes does not. Will push over docking unit unless its against wall. Lighthouse and 'wall' work well.
customer_reviews.author: JOHN MCALLISTER

customer_reviews.title: How did I live without this?
customer_reviews.text: Incredible, I have my own and a foster dog. Mine has hair, long Afghan/poodle hair. My foster sheds like crazy, more if she's stressed, happy, been bathed, it's spring or the sun comes up. So much for Roomba to do, along with the dirt my family tracks in, the crumbs everyone makes and general ickiness. Roomba gets it all, I usually run it a few times a day. How did I ever survive without it? I cannot believe we lived in all of the dirt!
customer_reviews.author: ganendal

customer_reviews.title: Works like a cleaning machine gone wild
customer_reviews.text: Works like a cleaning machine gone wild. Just turn it on and let it go. Takes a while to get the cat to come back down stairs. Lol But does a great job.
customer_reviews.author: Henry L. Clendaniel Jr.

customer_reviews.title: you pretty much need to vacuum every day to keep the ...
customer_reviews.text: We have two labs...you pretty much need to vacuum every day to keep the hair up. We run this thing a few hours each day and now we vacuum manually maybe once a month...just to get behind and under things where it can't reach. Only drawbacks are that it fills up frequently so you have to empty it a lot, and it's a little noisy. Does its job very well, however (mostly tile floors, but it does get up on some pretty thick rugs that we have too without any trouble).
customer_reviews.author: Jobe

customer_reviews.title: WOW!
customer_reviews.text: My Roomba 880 has been used for nearly 3 weeks now. I have it on a schedule to clean everyday at 11:00am. My floors are hardwood and tile and the 880 seems to be the perfect fit. I have 4 rescued cats and that is a job in itself for my wife and I to keep clean. This robot has takes 95% of that work off of us. The large bin holds a lot! I didn't know we missed so much on the floors until I bought this! The floors actually shine somewhat more now with the robot. Highly recommend it even if you do not have pets.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy C. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and Better than Older Roomba
customer_reviews.text: Super quiet and way more effective than my old 630 Roomba. This seems about 1/3 the noise and twice the cleaning power of my old roomba. It also runs twice as long (although that might be old battery). The noise factor is a huge benefit.
customer_reviews.author: G in H-Town

customer_reviews.title: My allergic reactions to dust and pet hair/dander are much ...
customer_reviews.text: My allergic reactions to dust and pet hair/dander are much lower now that I can have something else vacuum every day. My cats are entertained by it as well. It seems to actually clean some surfaces more thoroughly than my Dyson upright (with the correct attachments). Plus, litter box scatter is no longer a problem. Roomba roams the basement floor...
customer_reviews.author: Paul

product_meta.title: iRobot Roomba 880 Robot Vacuum
product_meta.description: Style Name:iRobot Roomba 880Experience a deeper, multi room clean every day with the Roomba 880 Vacuum Cleaning Robot. Featuring the revolutionary AeroForce Cleaning System, Roomba 880 delivers up to 5x the air power and requires less maintenance. Guided, room to room cleaning allows Roomba to tackle more of your home in one job. Just press clean or schedule Roomba to run up to 7x per week. Roomba works on all floor types, and at just 3.6 inch tall, is specifically designed to fit under most furniture, beds and kickboards.
feature_bullets: iAdapt Multi Room Navigation uses a full suite of sensors to navigate and adapt to your changing home
Room to room cleaning in up to 3 rooms with the included Virtual Wall Lighthouse beacons
AeroForce 3 Stage Cleaning System delivers up to 50 percent more cleaning performance
Tangle free extractors help prevent hair and debris clogs
AeroForce High Efficiency Filter traps fine dirt and dust

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars2,330 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
